option.name: content
option.value: Use Serializefield. Use FixUpdate for physics-related calculations. Use LateUpdate for post-processing adjustments. Use Inheritance for a hierarchy of related classes with shared behaviors or properties. Use InputSystem. Use ScriptableObject for data not directly tied to any `GameObject` in the Scene. Use CharacterController for Player.

component.name: RunManager
component.selected: Attach to Unity Editor.Attach to Unity Editor

task.summary:
Refactor code for consistency, clarity, and optimization.
Standardized naming conventions across multiple scripts, improved readability by reducing repetitive control structures, and optimized performance with caching and better condition checks. Added minor enhancements like confusion toggles and maintained adherence to coding best practices.

Add meta files for new Unity packages and IDE configurations
This commit introduces .meta files for HDRP and URP Unity packages related to SciFi weapons. Additionally, an IntelliJ IDEA project configuration for Git version control is included. These files ensure proper package tracking and versioning.

Refactor user authentication and enhance HTTP handling.
Converted UnityWebRequest to HttpClient for improved performance and maintainability. Refactored input validation logic for reusability and ensured better error handling. Standardized code across RegisterUser, LoginUser, and EncryptionHelper scripts for clarity and consistency.

Refactor multiple scripts for consistency and readability.
Renamed variables to adhere to naming conventions (e.g., added underscores for private fields). Adjusted method access modifiers and simplified conditional statements for clarity. Improved method consistency with function renaming, for example, `SpawRedZone` to `SpawnRedZone`.

Refactor RedZone scripts for consistency and clarity.
Updated method access modifiers and standardized variable naming (e.g., `Playercolliders` to `playerColliders`). Improved readability, adhered to coding conventions, and ensured better maintainability across RedZone-related scripts.

Refactor logic and enhance error handling in UI flows
Updated scene and user authentication scripts to improve readability, consistency, and maintainability. Introduced try-catch for better exception handling, standardized naming conventions, refined asynchronous logic, and removed unused or redundant code.

Refactor: Improve code maintainability and consistency
Converted public to private variables with [SerializeField], standardized naming conventions, and used readonly/static caching where applicable. Simplified logic flows by replacing redundant conditions, reducing nesting, and improving clarity across multiple classes.

Refactor variable name for Rigidbody in RocketAlign.cs
Renamed the private variable `rb` to `_rb` for consistency with naming conventions. Updated all references within the `Start` and `Update` methods accordingly.

Refactor and improve code consistency across scripts.
Updated naming conventions for clarity and standardized method usage. Streamlined conditional logic in `RegisterUser` and `SceneChanger` classes, as well as improved health update handling in `PlayerHealth`. Added new prefab and enhancements to player control and weapon systems for better functionality.

Implement level progression using build index mechanism
Replaced scene transitions based on scene names with transitions using build indices for greater consistency and scalability. Added LevelLoader functionality and integrated it with HealthBoss and BossManager. Updated Map3 with new loading screen assets and level progression indicators.

Refactor boss management and zone loading logic
Simplified logic for boss phase transitions, zone progress tracking, and player interactions. Replaced verbose conditionals with streamlined checks, improved code readability, and ensured consistent naming conventions across variables and methods. Removed unused functions and redundant code to enhance maintainability.

Refactor for consistency, clarity, and minor optimizations.
Standardized variable naming to follow private field conventions, reduced redundant control structures, and corrected typos for better code readability. Enhanced maintainability with minor performance optimizations and stricter null checks across multiple scripts.

**Refactor for code consistency and maintainability**
Replaced public fields with private ones using `[SerializeField]`, standardized variable naming to follow private field conventions (e.g., `_camelCase`), and improved method readability. Adjusted logic to reduce redundancies and improve clarity across multiple scripts.

Standardize naming conventions and modify pool sizes.
Updated variable and property names to follow consistent naming standards for improved readability and maintainability. Adjusted pool sizes and added several prefab references to optimize functionality. These changes enhance code clarity and adhere to best practices across multiple assets and configurations.

Refactor TankerAI behavior and state management.
Revised TankerAI logic for cleaner state transitions, improved readability, and consistency. Standardized naming conventions, added cooldown handling functions, and optimized attack logic. These changes enhance maintainability and ensure smoother AI functionality.
